review_title: Great place to work with wonderful supervisors
job_title: Part-time Student Employee in Berea, KY
pros: The student employment experience at Berea is a delight. Your supervisors are always thinking about your best interests. Yes, in my four years, I did hear of supervisors who were bad apples, but that is very rare.
cons: The pay. Although it is a scholarship and adds up to a significant amount if you factor in the scholarship aspect, the actual realized hourly pay is sometimes demotivating. I completely understand the reasoning behind it, but if there is a con, this is it.

job_title: Administrative Services Manager in Berea, KY
pros: -Folks want to see you succeed and grow. -Folks are always willing to roll up their sleeves to help you. -It is cheap to live in Berea.
cons: -Most places close down early in Berea. -Berea College tends to promote Berea grads more than non-grads, even if non-grads are more qualified and perform at higher levels.

pros: As a student, you gain experience in different fields.
cons: It can be hard to balance work and school.

review_title: Institution with lots of resources but a culture of overwork
pros: Lots of institutional funds, non-competitive atmosphere. Economically stable institution, relatively low cost of living in the region.
cons: Culture of overwork and an exceptionalist mindset that is not realistic. Are not in touch with the state of the industry and promote a cult-like, uncritical commitment to their mission.

pros: The college is built on a historic background being the first interracial college in the south as well as gender inclusive. The school takes pride in serving bright new minds from impoverished backgrounds around Appalachia,  thee United States and all over the world. The development team is very relaxed calm. Everybody is friendly and there is a feeling of gratitude to service for a bigger purpose than profit.
cons: Might be limiting in terms of mobility. Not a huge department. Most universities have a development team for every college but Berea just has one. It's also an under appreciated work considering most of the students benefit from the annual fund raising in the department. Many students may never know the work that gets done behind their backs.

review_title: Work-study a time constraint, but the experience is beneficial.
pros: Berea is a work-study fueled school. It offers you a stream of income while you are a student there which is very good. Students also get a chance to build their work experience and resumes while attending school. Most colleges churn out graduates who have little or no job experience, whereas employers of Berea students know that they have experience working throughout college.
cons: Working as a student can put an extreme burden on anyone who is not ready, or who does not have the ability to multitask. Being a student is hard enough but also being required to work 140 hours a semester (10 hours a week) can be a burden to some who have a lot of their plate to begin with.

review_title: Great college, hard to break into the staff culture
job_title: Senior Software Developer in Berea, KY
pros: The mission of Berea is admirable, and the staff really want to make it happen. Management is reasonable, extremely open, and diverse.
cons: The majority of staff are Berea Alums who never worked elsewhere, and don't like or respect opinions about how other, sometimes more successful programs, operate differently. Lots of talk in meetings about the "Berea way" which can often feel like shorthand for not rocking the boat. Compensation is much lower compared to the local market, and staff are encouraged to donate back to the college (mostly because large grants require colleges to have a certain percentage of staff donors to qualify).

pros: Berea College is one of the few "work colleges" in the U.S., meaning every enrolled student is required to participate in the College's labor program. Students who demonstrate initiative can secure some incredible jobs on campus to learn important skills (public speaking, networking, collaboration, etc.) that will be very useful upon graduating from the College.
cons: For students in senior leadership positions, it would be helpful to have more leadership development resources. Students are expected to accomplish a good deal through the labor program, but leadership development is not often a top priority (or resource) of the labor program. Students in senior leadership positions through the labor program need more leadership development support.

review_title: Berea College would benefit from joining the 21st century.
pros: Many of the people at Berea live the vision of providing a higher education to those who would not otherwise get one.  They truly care about preparing students for the wider world.  The setting is lovely and there is lots to do on campus.
cons: Parts of the college are woefully behind the times in technology, staffing, management practices and workplace issues.  Quite a bit of micro-managing still occurs.

pros: The best part of the process of working at Berea was how important they made the labor program feel and how many yearly activities we're centered around celebrating work and labor. It helped with building community.
cons: The system processes for labor could definitely be improved. There are plenty of examples in other companies such as Amazon of having simple application and job placement systems in place. Middle Tier management at Berea are extremely incompetent. However the higher you went or even lower towards the students you often found more competent workers.

review_title: I would describe my overall experience as a positive one and one that I would reccomend to others.
pros: Good education, flexibility to work in the area that you either like or will help you with the area you intend to go into after graduating.
cons: There are not many but the politics of the work space were sometimes unfortunate in that people were favored and others were not given the promotions or feedback they deserved.

pros: The people are great and there is a really fun atmosphere. The office is only open on weekdays which is really nice.
cons: The pay is terrible like all Berea College student positions. It can also be a stressful environment when there are people who are upset at you.

pros: This was a work-study position and students had to juggle labour and academic assignments simultaneously. It was an excellent way of learning to prioritize both responsibilities while gaining practical workplace skills.
cons: I would have liked some more research activities and opportunities to enhance the research assistant part of the job.

pros: Berea College provides jobs for the students while attending the college. If you know what you want to work in after graduation, this can be very beneficial. While each department is different, they are generally sensitive to class schedules and other college requirements.
cons: Some departments or jobs are treated more seriously than others, and you get a wide range of response from student workers. The work that student provide isn't always appreciated.
